revised_title: Analysis of X-Rays Emitted by Various Metals
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to analyze the composition of X-rays emitted by various metals, such as iron, nickel, copper, aluminum, and platinum. They used a crystal-spectrometer and absorption screens to study the homogeneous components of the X-rays and their absorption coefficients. The results showed that different metals treated the X-rays differently, and the proportion of each radiation present in a beam of rays could be detected and analyzed.
